page.title: 01Hills west of Burniston
page.content: Mostly in National Park is used for farming and forestry large conferous plantations cover some of the higher grounds and steep slopes while sheep, dairy and arable farming predominate in the flat south section and in the north easten areas. Roads are minor and the only village is a collection of a few houses or farms at silpho, and there are a few more farms scattered about. As a rural area, hilly and forested it is much visited by tourists who enjoy the walking and superb views from such places as Reasty Hill top which there are forestry commission parking and picnic sites. there are some deeduous woodlands to add to the variety. There are no other amenities so tourists just visit for the day and drive or walk through. Residents are mostly involved in farming.
